newsitem.title: UK: SBC, FCT named as LIFFE's new BOBL market makers.
newsitem.headline: SBC, FCT named as LIFFE's new BOBL market makers.

text.p: SBC Warburg and FCT Europe Ltd were named on Monday as the market makers for LIFFE's new Bobl futures and options contracts, the exchange said.

SBC Warburg will act as the designated market maker in the Bobl futures, and FCT won the bid to be the market maker in the Bobl options. LIFFE also confirmed that the new contracts will start trading on September 18, 1997.
"Both companies have made a commitment to provide guaranteed liquidity to the market throughout the open outcry session," LIFFE said.

As designated market-maker, SBC Warburg is committed to providing a maximum bid/offer spread of two ticks in a minimum size of at least 200 lots in the most actively traded futures contract month, representing a nominal value of 50 million marks.
FCT commited to provide a maximum bid/offer spread of three ticks in a minimum size of at least 300 lots in the most actively traded options.
LIFFE said it has waived transaction fees for six months for the Bobl, medium term German government debt contracts, and the London Clearing House has waived clearing fees for the same period.
Members will also be able to clear and offset margin calls in futures and options contracts across the mark yield curve through one clearing house.
